title: A Catalogue of the Different Specimens of Cloth Collected in the Three voyages of Captain Cook, to the Southern Hemisphere, with a Particular Account of the Manner of the Manufacturing the Same in the Various Islands of the South Seas: Partly Extracted from Mr. Anderson and Reinhold Forster's Observations, and the Verbal Account of Some of the Most Knowing of the Navigators: With Some Anecdotes That Happened to Them Among the Natives
